required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Integration of Health Coaching and Diabetes Education in Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Management at Primary Health Care
clinical_study.official_title: The Integration of Health Coaching and Diabetes Education in Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Patients at Jakarta Primary Health Care: Role on Metabolic Control, Diabetes Complications, Inflammatory Marker, Behavior Changes, and Quality of Life

brief_summary.textblock: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus is a chronic disease with increasing incidence globally. It needs a comprehensive and continuous management approach that includes five pillars: education, nutritional management, physical activity, pharmacological treatment, and monitoring. To achieve good glycemic control, prevention of complications, and good quality of life as diabetes management goals, patients' capability to properly navigate diabetes management is a key. One evidence-based model to empower patients' self-management abilities is diabetes education and health coaching. Diabetes management at primary health care needs special concern since they play an important role in initial and continuing care for diabetes patients in the community. Therefore, the implementation of diabetes education and health coaching in primary health care is expected to improve the self-management abilities of people with diabetes

detailed_description.textblock:
A randomized control trial, pre and post study involving 180 subjects randomized into 2 arms:
- Control : received education in group
- Intervention : received education group + personal health coaching Education group divided into 6 session, which for each session consist of 2 different topics and lasts for 60 minutes.
Health coaching was given by a coach, a healthcare professional who undergo training to become a coach. Health coaching delivered as face to face between subjects and coach.
Laboratory examination, anthropometric measurement, echocardiography, electrocardiography, Heart Rate Variability measurement, diabetic eye screening, and questionnaire collected at baseline, 3 and 6 months after intervention

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline HbA1C at 3 months and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: HbA1C is indicator of glycemic control

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline fasting plasma glucose at 3 and 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Blood glucose monitoring

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline serum lipid at 3 and 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Lipid profile measurement includes total cholesterol, LDL-cholesterol, HDL-cholesterol, and triglycerides

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline inflammatory marker at 3 and 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Inflammatory marker used is hs-CRP (C-reactive protein)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline body mass index
secondary_outcome.description: Body mass index described by kg/m2

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline waist circumference
secondary_outcome.description: Waist circumference measured by cm

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline body fat
secondary_outcome.description: Body fat measured by body impedance analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline left ventricular mass index
secondary_outcome.description: Left ventricular mass index measured using standard formula and corrected by body surface area

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline left ventricular systolic function
secondary_outcome.description: Left ventricular systolic funciton was calculated from ejection fraction and global longitudinal strain (measured by echocardiography)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline left atrial volume
secondary_outcome.description: Left atrial volume was measured through biplane area calculation in echocardiography procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline right ventricular systolic function
secondary_outcome.description: Right ventricular systolic function was evaluated using TAPSE

secondary_outcome.measure: change from baseline left ventricular diastolic function
secondary_outcome.description: LV diastolic function was evaluated according to algorithm recommended by American Society of Echochardiography in 2016

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline electrocardiography pattern
secondary_outcome.description: Electrocardiography pattern was used to analyze cardiac rythm

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline heart rate variability
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate variability was measured using ECG Holter examination

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline visual acuity
secondary_outcome.description: Visual acuity was measured by Peek acuity chart application using WHO classification

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline lens haziness
secondary_outcome.description: Lens haziness was evaluated using shadow test

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline retina examination
secondary_outcome.description: Retina was examined using funduscopic photography

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline intraocular pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Intraocular pressure was measured by cup-to-disc ratio using funduscopic photograpy

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline peripheral sensory neuropathy
secondary_outcome.description: Peripheral sensory neuropathy was measured using combination of subjective manifestation, 10 g Simme Weinstein monofilament and 128 Hz tuning fork

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline peripheral autonomic neuropathy
secondary_outcome.description: Peripheral autonomic neuropathy was seen visually by objective examination (dry, scaly skin and cracked skin)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline peripheral motor neuropathy
secondary_outcome.description: Peripheral motor neuropathy was seen visually by objective examination (changes in the shape of fingers, muscle atrophy, or bone protrusions)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline peripheral arterial disease
secondary_outcome.description: Peripheral arterial disease was diagnosed through ankle brachial index measurement

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline renal function
secondary_outcome.description: Renal function was measured by estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) using creatinine data

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline albuminuria
secondary_outcome.description: Albuminuria was measured by albumin creatinine ratio

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline mean calorie intake
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of mean calorie intake using food record data

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline global physical activity
secondary_outcome.description: Global physical activity was evaluated by global physical activity questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline medication adherence
secondary_outcome.description: Medication adherence was measured by Morisky Medication Adherence Scale (MMAS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline quality of life
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life was evaluated by EuroQol five-dimensional questionnaire. This questionnaire evaluates 5 dimensions of life. Each dimension scores 1-5 (1 means no problem and 5 means extreme problems).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Received Personal Health Coaching and Diabetes Education in Group
arm_group.description: Health coaching was given as face to face with a trained coach from primary health care. Diabetes education in group, with trained educator team from primary health care
Diabetes education in group, with trained educator team from primary health care

intervention.intervention_name: Personal Health Coaching and Diabetes Education in Group
intervention.description: Health coaching was given as face to face with a trained coach from primary health care. Diabetes education in group, with trained educator team from primary health care
intervention.arm_group_label: Received Personal Health Coaching and Diabetes Education in Group

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
- >= 18 years old
- Willing to follow the research by signing an informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with cognitive disease (such as dementia)
- Patients with hearing or sight problem
- Unable to live independently on daily basis

overall_official.affiliation: Divisi Metabolik Endokrin IPD FKUI RSCM

responsible_party.investigator_title: DR. dr. Em Yunir, SpPD, KEMD
